summary.para: Adds extension pages to the wizard by filling an array with handles to structures representing those pages.

param.name: aPages
param.para: A pointer to an array of handles that represent the wizard dialog pages. Handles to PROPSHEETPAGE structures for the extension pages are added to this array.

param.name: cPages
param.para: The count of elements in aPages.

param.name: pnPagesAdded
param.para: The count of handles successfully added.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The array of handles pointed to by aPages can contain handles to wizard dialog pages preceding and following the extension pages. The array's pointer should be passed to this method so that its value is the first empty array element, ready to accept the handle of the first extension page, rather than simply the first element. Collaterally, the value passed in cPages should state the number of unused array elements instead of the total number.
For example, if two introductory host pages were added to an array called hpages, then the call to IWizardExtension.AddPages would appear as follows.

Do not confuse wizard pages, which are structures, with hosted HTML pages. One wizard dialog page can host many sequential HTML pages. This method supplies the number of wizard dialog pages added by the wizard extension, not the number of server-side HTML pages which are displayed in it.

summary.para: Gets a handle to the first page of the wizard extension.

param.name: phpage
param.para: A pointer to a handle representing the first page of any wizard extension pages.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Although the wizard extension may host several sequential HTML pages, if it consists of only one page, the handles returned by IWizardExtension.GetFirstPage and are the same.

summary.para: Gets a handle to the final page of the wizard extension pages.

param.name: phpage
param.para: A pointer to a handle representing the wizard extension's final page.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This value is used to navigate backward into the wizard extension pages when the user clicks the Back button.
Although the wizard extension may host several sequential HTML pages, if it consists of only one page the handles returned by and IWizardExtension.GetLastPage are the same.

summary.para: Used by wizards such as the Web Publishing Wizard and Online Print Ordering Wizard which host server-side content pages. This interface exposes methods to specify supported extension pages and to navigate into and out of those pages.
